featured.text: Since the 1990s, alternative proms have been organized in some areas to meet the needs of particular students.

After the 1960s, and especially since the 1980s, the high school prom in many areas has become a serious exercise in excessive consumption, with boys renting expensive tuxedos and girls wearing designer gowns.
The word “prom” was first used in the 1890s, referring to formal dances in which the guests of a party would display their fashions and dancing skills during the evening’s grand march.
Prom night can be a dreadful experience for socially awkward teens or for those who do not secure dates.

other.text: Therefore, proms have been held every year in high schools for students to learn proper social behavior.
Stretch limousines were hired to drive the prom-goers to expensive restaurants or discos for an all-night extravaganza.
In the 1890s, high school proms were all-night social events for some American families.
By the 1930s, proms were common across the country.
For example, proms organized by and for homeless youth were reported.
For many older Americans, the prom was a modest, home-grown affair in the school gymnasium.
In the United States, parents and educators have come to regard the prom as an important lesson in social skills.
What is the main idea of the third paragraph? (A) Proper social behavior must be observed by prom-goers.
Which of the following statements is true? (A) Unconventional proms have been organized since the 1960s.
There were also “couple-free” proms to which all students are welcome.
In what way are high school proms significant to American teenagers?
According to the passage, what gave rise to alternative proms? (A) Not all students behaved well at the proms.
The prom has changed from a modest event to a glamorous party over the years. 47.
In the 1980s, proms were held in local churches for teenagers to attend.
Whether simple or lavish, proms have always been more or less traumatic events for adolescents who worry about self-image and fitting in with their peers.
Prom-goers were well dressed but not fancily dressed up for the occasion: boys wore jackets and ties and girls their Sunday dresses.
The first high school proms were held in the 1920s in America.

definition.zh_def: 高中或大學的舞會，通常在學年結束時舉行。
definition.en_def: A formal dance held at a high school or college, typically at the end of the academic year.
definition.example: She wore a beautiful dress to the prom.
